intro: Microlicia schwackeana, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant produces small, round, green fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Microlicia schwackeana is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
